nodes.text: Internet of Things (IoT) can enable home automation that remotely controls appliances and improves human life convenience and efficiency
IoT is the extension of the internet that connects devices via sensors and networks to enable automated, remote operation
IoT-based home appliances can be remotely monitored and controlled without direct human intervention

Key benefits of IoT-enabled home automation include better device monitoring, increased efficiency and time savings, energy and cost savings, improved quality of life, creation of smart environment behaviors, and health monitoring
Practical IoT home automation systems have been implemented using WiFi and other communication infrastructures and can be low cost and expandable
IoT applications span multiple sectors relevant to home automation including smart cities, industrial automation, healthcare, and environmental monitoring
Major IoT communication technologies and protocols for home and related applications include Bluetooth/BLE, ZigBee, Z-Wave, WiFi, Cellular (GSM/3G/4G), NFC, and LoRaWAN
This paper is a literature review synthesizing existing research and prototypes of IoT home automation systems and IoT technologies
Combining artificial intelligence with IoT is proposed as a future direction to further improve convenience and comfort
Smart environment behaviors can include automated window and shade control based on sun and wind to regulate indoor conditions and pollution monitoring
IoT health monitoring devices can track vital patterns (heart rate, blood pressure, digestion) and assist clinicians and vulnerable populations
Prior implementations report WiFi-based prototypes achieving remote appliance control and demonstrate scalability and flexibility advantages over some commercial systems

Protocol trade-offs: BLE reduces power for wearables; ZigBee offers low-power, secure mesh networks; Z-Wave targets home devices; WiFi gives high throughput but high power; Cellular enables long-range but higher cost and power; LoRaWAN enables low-power wide-area networks
Security and privacy vulnerabilities and the need for user IT expertise are barriers to IoT adoption and reliability
